A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Leaving the theater last night I was left speechless\, not because it was an awesome movie but rather because I felt like the movie fell short. All the build up from the previous movie led to nothing. I don't know what movie the critics saw but it was definitely not this one. Feel like critics today are being paid by big business (Disney) to rave about a movie\, even if it sucks\, so that the hype is enough to get people to the theaters\, pay and make a mediocre film billions when it shouldn't. Critics should be ashamed of themselves for misleading people to believe a movie is great! Don't agree with me? The polarizing reviews between major critics and the average reviewer are a clear indication that I'm right.
